sections.title: Overview
details: A free food event calendar for the University of Maryland College Park campus

sections.title: Apps Script Site
details: wanted to run a scipt on users email that looked for key words such as "free food, pizza, cookies, subs, etc"
The script would look for a time and date in the email as well, and then create a calendar event on ths users gcal, which could then be shared with other seefood users
this did not work, most people didn't get information about free food in their email like I did. There were also privacy concerns with this random script reading people email
On signup, the permission looked pretty scary and I had to comfort peoples concets so they'd accept
Made for emails thing

sections.title: Groupchat
details: made when email didn't work as expected
started with about 13 ppl as a "customer suport" solution to email sends failing
People started posting about events there and adding each other
eventually grew to about 1300 students

Had to act as a moderator and remove poeple who were posting about things other than free food events. if poeple made jokes or put events not about free food they were removed to keep it runnning smoothly
brought in crowdsourcing ideas

sections.title: Landing Page
details: linked to web app
built for pitch competitions and other presentations I had to do, also to collect signups and explain the rationale behind this idea
worked on tech/businss jargon and communicatig ideas to customer quickly
bootstrap template to work on communicating with customers

sections.title: Web App
details: edit, add, delete, events
chronological list
showed likes
approximately 300 signups
launched without email verification and immediately had to add this - someone used a profs email to sign up and post a prank event
launched the website from a hotel room in california before a tech interview

sections.title: Impact
details: Thousands of students helped
count up number of events

lots of people didn't take it seriously and thought I was just some guy trying to get free food. In the end I was able to connect thousands of students to events and organizations in their community that they wouldn't have originally heard of.
many people would say the idea was dumb or bad and then post the events for their organization on the website or app
Got recognized all around campus because of my picture in the groupchat, and spoke some panels about entrepreneurship around campus
